alert.note: Alert for Henrico; King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:28PM EDT until July 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN...NORTHEASTERN HENRICO...SOUTH CENTRAL CAROLINE...SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER AND NORTHWESTERN KING WILLIAM COUNTIES... At 228 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Newtown to East Highland Park, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Saint Stephens Church around 235 PM EDT. Manquin around 250 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Enfield, Central Garage, Owenton, Hanover Airport, Upshaw, Etna Mills, Epworth, Westwood, Biscoe and Calno. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
